channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'We’re here to...': Trump visits Georgia to offer support after Hurricane Helene's destruction
item.description: Former President Trump visited Valdosta, Georgia, promising support to those affected by Hurricane Helene. The storm has caused severe damage across multiple states, leaving many unaccounted for. Trump and relief organization Samaritan’s Purse are providing essential supplies, and he urged increased federal aid from President Biden.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: California’s landmark AI safety bill blocked by governor amid tech industry backlash
item.description: California governor Gavin Newsom has vetoed a pivotal AI safety bill amid significant opposition from tech giants like OpenAI, Google, and Meta. The legislation sought strict safety measures but faced criticism for potentially hindering innovation. Newsom plans to seek expert input for future safeguards against AI risks.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Judge overturns Georgia’s six-week abortion law, reinstates 22-week limit
item.description: A Georgia judge has invalidated the state's six-week abortion ban, deeming it unconstitutional. This decision allows abortions up to 22 weeks, overturning a restrictive 2019 law. Judge Robert McBurney emphasized women's autonomy and rights over their own bodies, noting that fetal survival outside the womb should be a crucial consideration.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Biden presses for cease-fire, urges Netanyahu to abandon planned Lebanon invasion after Nasrallah killing
item.description: US President Joe Biden has urged Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to halt plans for a potential invasion of southern Lebanon after Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah's assassination. Amidst expectations of Israeli military action, Biden called for a cease-fire, emphasizing restraint. This request highlights the ongoing tension between Biden and Netanyahu regarding Israel's response to Hezbollah's retaliatory attacks.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Rudy Giulani's daughter Caroline endorses Kamala: 'Trump took my dad from me'
item.description: Donald Trump's former lawyer Rudy Giulani's daughter Caroline endorsed Kamala Harris and Tim Walz and warned America against voting for Donald Trump. ​ "Trump destroys everything he touches. I saw it happen to my family. Don’t let it happen to yours, or to our country. Kamala Harris will guide us into a brighter future, but only if we unite behind her," Caroline wrote.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I was...': US President Joe Biden gets defensive over reporter question on Hurricane Helene
item.description: President Biden addressed concerns about his absence from Washington during Hurricane Helene. He assured the federal government's commitment to aid victims and detailed ongoing relief efforts. Biden emphasized staying connected with local leaders and deployed over 3,600 personnel. He urged residents to heed emergency warnings and pledged to support the affected areas until recovery is complete.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hillary Clinton urges Kamala Harris to 'defeat Donald Trump' in crucial election
item.description: Hillary Clinton praises Joe Biden's decision to step aside after a poor debate against Trump. She highlights the critical nature of the upcoming election with Kamala Harris now facing Trump, emphasizing its international impact, particularly concerning US aid to Ukraine and economic policies affecting Trump supporters.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israeli journalist raises a toast on air on Hassan Nasrallah's death. Video viral
item.description: According to a report, Segal asked 'who's drinking?' as he raised the toast. His fellow panelist Ben Caspit said he would but former Israeli military chief spokesperson Ronen Manelis apparently refused. “Really, everyone is happy that Nasrallah is dead,” Manelis said, as reported by New York Post. “[But] let’s think about the residents who had to flee their homes [due to the rocket bombardments].”​
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UK shuts down its last coal power station
item.description: Britain has shut down its last coal-fired power station, marking an end to 142 years of coal reliance. The Ratcliffe-on-Soar plant ceased operations, symbolizing the UK's significant progress towards a cleaner energy future. The country has seen substantial growth in renewable energy, with coal now contributing a mere 1.8% to its electricity mix.
item.dc:creator: NAOMI CANTON

item.title: 'Those numbers could...': MSNBC guest warns about Latino voter trends affecting Kamala Harris
item.description: Maria Hinojosa expressed on MSNBC that many Latino voters may be shifting toward the Republican Party, identifying with White Americans. She noted Kamala Harris' declining lead among Latino voters, warning that this trend could pose challenges for Harris in the upcoming election.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: VP debate between JD Vance and Tim Walz: 10 things to know
item.description: JD Vance versus Tim Walz is a high-stake debate because they have attacked and counter-attacked each other on several issues including what JD Vance called Tim Walz's 'stolen record'. JD Vance is a confident orator, debater and Tim Walz is reportedly anxious ahead of the debate fearing that he would let down Kamala Harris. But Walz's advantage is the political fumbles that the GOP made and many of them are credited to JD including the recent rumor of Haitians eating pets.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Verizon service outage strands thousands of users in 'SOS' mode across US
item.description: Verizon faced major outages affecting thousands of users in cities including Chicago and Indianapolis on Monday. Issues began around 9.30am ET and caused over 66,000 outage reports by midday. Verizon is working to resolve it. Meanwhile, AT&T had fewer reports and claims no nationwide issue. Verizon recently announced a $3.3 billion mobile towers deal.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: British woman reveals harrowing childhood abuse in Osho’s 'sex cult'
item.description: A British woman detailed the sexual abuse she endured from the age of six within Osho's Sannyasin communities. She described being exposed to and participating in sexual acts as a child. The upcoming documentary 'Children of the Cult' explores such abuse within these communities.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Batsh*t crazy': Donald Trump's son comments on Mark Cuban's warning to Elon Musk
item.description: ​Donald Trump Jr took a swipe at Mark Cuban and said Mark Cuban and the Left are so corrupt that they literally expect favors. "At least we now know why he's taking these bats**t crazy positions. Thanks for clarifying for everyone!" Trump Jr wrote in response to Mark Cuban's words of caution for Elon Musk that Donald Trump's loyalty lies only for himself.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Man accused of attempting to assassinate Trump at Florida golf course pleads not guilty
item.description: Ryan Routh, accused of attempting to assassinate former US President Donald Trump, pleaded not guilty to five federal charges. An agent spotted Routh's rifle at Trump's Florida golf course, preventing the attack. Routh fled and was later apprehended. Evidence includes a note offering $150,000 for Trump's assassination. No shots were fired, and Trump was unhurt.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Crooked and obscene': Donald Trump's naked statue is back. Who makes these installations?
item.description: ​The 43-ft statue will now tour across the United States as part of the "Crooked and Obscene Tour". The tour organizers not named by the Wrap said portraying Trump in the nude is "intentional, serving as a bold statement on transparency, vulnerability and the public personas of political figures". "They also aim to spark conversation about “transparency—or lack thereof—in politics, challenging viewers to think critically about political influence,” according to the organizers.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris' husband called 'wife guy'. MAGA supporters remind he cheated on first wife
item.description: " To me it's the right thing to do -- support women -- it's mutual with Kamala, we support each other, we have each other's back. I have said many times that when we lift up women whether it's pay equity, childcare, family leave and all these issues...women should not have less rights. That's not the American way. It's also not like that if some women succeed, some dudes there are suffering. It's not one-to-one relationship. When we lift up women, we lift up families, economy," Doug said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Creep' Mohamed Al-Fayed's indecent proposal left Princess Diana shaking, reveals butler
item.description: ​​“I was in the car when she (Princess Diana) came running out from his office shaking and told me, and these are her exact words, that he said, ‘I want you to marry my son because in Egyptian tradition, the father goes first’," Burrell said. "Can you imagine making love to Yoda?" Diana told Burrell. “Diana was repulsed by the thought of having to surrender to him. By making that comment, he was setting the stage for that encounter and he was serious."
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Over 90,000 Georgia residents sheltering a day after chemical plant fire sent chlorine into the air
item.description: More than 90,000 residents near Conyers, Georgia, were told to shelter in place after a fire at the BioLab chemical plant released harmful chlorine into the air. The fire, caused by a malfunctioning sprinkler head, was brought under control, and no injuries were reported. Interstate 20 has reopened.

item.title: 'Purge'? Why Donald Trump's latest plan of 'one rough day' to end crime draws flak
item.description: ​In MSNBC's Morning Joe, the anchor suggested that Trump did suggest an hour of violence. "He did suggest there should be an hour of violence, which sounds like the plot of 'The Purge,' which is deeply dangerous. We know how his words have inspired violence before, including but not limited to January 6," Jonathan Lemire said. "His followers are hearing what he's saying," Lemire added.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
